alert.note: Alert for Palm Beach (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 30 at 7:54PM EDT until further notice by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Florida, including the following county, Palm Beach. * WHEN...Until 830 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 752 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated that the thunderstorms have dissipated over the area. However, moderate rains still continue over the advisory area. Rainfall amounts between 2 to 4 inches have fallen over the area from the earlier thunderstorms, and additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch is still possible. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... West Palm Beach, Palm Beach Gardens, Riviera Beach, Palm Beach, Juno Beach, North Palm Beach, Lake Park, Port Of Palm Beach, Schall Circle, Downtown West Palm Beach, Juno Ridge, Palm Beach International Airport, Mangonia Park, Lakeside Green, Fau North Campus and Westgate-Belvedere Homes. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
